name: TFVCCheckin
description: Checks in any files changed in the repository.
author: Jesse Houwing

groups.name: confirmationOptions
groups.displayName: Checking in files from a build is generally a bad idea

inputs.helpMarkdown:
If your build system dived into an endless loop, uses up all your build minutes or destroys your source tree by accident. You've signaled you understand this risk, the task won't work without this consent.

[More Information](https://github.com/jessehouwing/vsts-tfvc-tasks/wiki)
inputs.label: I understand
inputs.name: ConfirmUnderstand

inputs.helpMarkdown: Adds a special string to the check-in comment to ensure that no other build is triggered.
inputs.label: Bypass CI on check-in
inputs.name: IncludeNoCIComment

inputs.helpMarkdown: To override any check-in policies or changeset-notes that may be required by your administrator.
inputs.label: Override policies
inputs.name: OverridePolicy

inputs.helpMarkdown: When enabling Override Policies, you're required to specify a reason. This reason is stored with the changeset.
inputs.label: Override reason
inputs.name: OverridePolicyReason

inputs.helpMarkdown:
Specify one or more paths, separated by `;` or newline. While wildcards (`?`, `*`) are supported, they're not the same as the minimatch patterns used by other build tasks and do **not** support the recursive wildcard `**`.

Example: `$/MyTeamproject/Main/*.cs`
inputs.label: Files to check in
inputs.name: ItemSpec

inputs.helpMarkdown: Specify one or more checkin notes using the following format `Name=Value` or `Name:Value` separated by `;` or newline.
inputs.label: Notes
inputs.name: Notes

inputs.helpMarkdown: Controls whether you'll be checking in just the current folder/file (None), one level below the selected path (One Level) or all levels below the selected path (Full).
inputs.label: Recursion
inputs.name: Recursion

inputs.helpMarkdown: The comment which will show up in the source control history for this changeset.
inputs.label: Check-in comment
inputs.name: Comment
